questions.question: What is the term for the bending of light as it passes from one medium to another?
Which type of mirror is used in a rearview mirror of a car?
What is the SI unit of optical power?
What is the critical angle in optics?
options: The angle of incidence at which total internal reflection occurs
The angle of refraction in a medium
The angle of reflection from a mirror
The angle at which diffraction is maximum
questions.answer: The angle of incidence at which total internal reflection occurs

questions.question: What type of lens is used to correct myopia (nearsightedness)?
A convex lens always forms a real image.
Total internal reflection can only occur when light travels from a denser medium to a less dense medium.
Describe the phenomenon of chromatic aberration and how it affects optical systems.
questions.answer: Chromatic aberration occurs when different wavelengths of light refract at different angles, causing color fringing and blurring in optical systems.

questions.question: Explain why a rainbow forms when sunlight passes through water droplets in the air.
questions.answer: A rainbow forms due to dispersion, refraction, and reflection of sunlight within water droplets, separating light into different colors.

questions.question: A concave mirror has a focal length of 20 cm. If an object is placed 30 cm from the mirror, where is the image located?
A light wave has a frequency of 5.0 x 10^14 Hz. What is its wavelength in a vacuum? (c = 3.0 x 10^8 m/s)
Explain how polarization is used in 3D movie technology.
questions.answer: 3D glasses use polarizing filters to separate light intended for each eye. The left and right lenses filter light waves differently, creating depth perception.

questions.question: Discuss the advantages of fiber optics over traditional copper wiring for transmitting data.
questions.answer: Fiber optics provide faster data transmission, less signal loss, greater bandwidth, and immunity to electromagnetic interference.
